alert.note: Alert for Santa Ynez Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued July 21 at 9:05AM PDT until July 23 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT SATURDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, temperatures up to 96. For the Excessive Heat Watch, dangerously hot conditions with temperatures up to 96 possible. * WHERE...Santa Ynez Valley. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, until 8 PM PDT Saturday. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from Saturday evening through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
